text.title: part12_BDSM as business: Interviews with Dominatrixes

p.s: If you do n’t enjoy what you are doing , you should n’t be there .

s.hi: DS : What ’s the difference between obedience and submission ?

p.s: Huh , that ’s a good question
That ’s a really good question .
Obedience , I would say , is not as intense as submission .
Submission is they want to serve you and have you be a Goddess to them .
They are doing it willingly , whereas obedience is ‘ ’ you have to ’ ’
Yeah , a little bit , yeah .
They have to do it .
Submission is more they want to do it .
I feel like obedience is completing tasks for somebody —
Yeah , “ Go get me a glass of milk ! ” [ Laughs ]
But submission is , “ I am going to put my foot in your face and have you lick the bottom of my boot ! ”

s.hi: DS : How do you know that line between personal and impersonal in such a personal experience ?

p.s: First , we do n’t get a real chance to talk to them .
They just want a fantasy and a lot of time they do n’t want you to know the motivations behind it , because maybe they are a little disturbed by it .
You only have a small window to chat with them at the end , and it ’s usually superficial .
You want them to maintain the idea of who you are .
You never ever want to let them know who you are , really , because that would snatch the fantasy of this power woman who is here because she enjoys making men feel like shit !
Yeah , let me tell you about my cats !
That ’s true . [ laughs ]
I like Art History and I talk to people about that , about galleries and museums .

s.hi: DS : Do you think BDSM leads to domestic violence at all ?

p.s: No !
Not at all !
It ’s the media that makes that connection , but I honestly have not ever heard of it .
It goes against everything S&M is , which is about consent , about the fact that you have somebody giving themselves to you .
It ’s all about trust .
It ’s why we even have these safe words here .
It ’s for the fact that if anything goes above and beyond anything they want , you can just say , “ Now I want you to stop . ”
You want to give people the level of pain that THEY want , so it ’s not about going off on people and beating the crap out of them willy-nilly without consent .
Sometimes if they want to be taken past that level of pain they have experienced before , and they get into deep , deep places , you hurt them more than they are used to .

But I ’m not here because I want to take my aggressions out on them , although some of the real serious people ARE sort of vampires like that and really want you to hate them and take aggression out on them .
You ca n’t really group the clients in one cluster .
Most of them who come in here are really smart , intellectual people —
